sentences.sContent: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.sCn: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.sContent: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.sCn: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.sContent: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.sCn: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

hwds.w: take a turn for the worse

remMethod.val: 破坏(spoil)土地(soil)， 损人不利己

words.tran: 宠坏；毁坏（spoil的过去式及过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc
